result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy L Darby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The court orders the defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 plus all costs, assessments and surcharges, provide DNA sample and pay costs.  BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED. non-payment of outstanding balance, if any, by review date of 5-2-2016 will result in civil judgment.

Court orders defendant to perform 20 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization and to provide proof on the review date and failure to complete will result in 10 days House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.
Review hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy L Darby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA HEARING commencing OCTOBER 12, 2015 received and filed. (8 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to JOHN SCHIRO   735 W. WI AVE. FL. 12   MILW 53233-2413

Atty Schiro has provided written proof of the defendant's completion of 35 hours of community service at Hilside Terrace Family Resource Center and fine and all costs have been paid in full.  Defendant is in compliance with sentence imposed on 10-30-2015; the review date for 5-2-2016 is removed from the court calendar.

Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing 10-30-2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)  CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  ATTORNEY JOHN SHIRO, PRIVATE ATTORNEY, 735 W. WISCONSIN AVENUE, 12TH FLOOR, MILWAUKEE, WI  53233.

Defendant Tammy L Darby in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by parties.  Additional statement by Germenica O.
The court orders the defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 plus all costs, assessments and surcharges, provide DNA sample and pay costs.  BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED. non-payment of outstanding balance, if any, by review date of 5-2-2016 will result in civil judgment.
Court orders defendant to perform 20 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization and to provide proof on the review date and failure to complete will result in 10 days House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.
The court will set a review date on 5-2-2016.  Review hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Tammy L Darby in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for trial today. however, parties have reached a resolution.  There is a stipulation that this is no longer a DV related charge.
To the charge of Disorderly Conduct while armed:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing is adjourned to 10-30-2015.

Defendant Tammy L Darby in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse. Case is adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-12-2015 at 8:15 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Tammy L Darby in court with attorney George David Kidd.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense received discovery and offer was made. Court ordered the Defendant to follow all the conditions of probation, which includes no possession of any firearms or weapons, and no contact with the victims.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 05/11/2015
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 05/11/2015
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 05/11/2015

Court ordered the remainder of the bail to be returned to the remitter. 
Court ordered the Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Germonica O. (d.o.b. 07/22/68); Germonica O. (d.o.b. 03/24/89); Trichia O.; and Shafana O.

Defendant Tammy L Darvy in court with attorney George David Kidd.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 4.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/13/15 @ 1:30pm
